newsitem.title: USA: Aetrium test model gets $16 mln in orders.
newsitem.headline: Aetrium test model gets $16 mln in orders.

text.p: Aetrium Inc said Wednesday it has received orders totaling $16 million for its M3200 product which tests integrated circuits.
The orders, which include the largest single order in the company's history, are from more than one North American producer of memory integrated circuits. The companies were not identified.
The M3200 is a model produced by Aetrium's San Diego, Calif. division. The units have been scheduled for manufacture and will be shipped over the next 12 months.
"These orders solidify the M3200's position as a leading pick-and-place test handler for memory devices," said Joseph Levesque, president, in a statement.

He noted that these customers have become firmer in their production plans for 1997 and beyond, and instead of ordering the equipment one or two machines at a time they have committed to volume purchases.
Aetrium supplies technologies and equipment that are used by the semiconductor industry to assemble and test integrated circuits. Aetrium reported 1996 sales of about $58.4 million.
